meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Time to get my groove on and review Hauntii!

As a seasonal grok video game reviewer, I'm all about having fun and not taking myself too seriously (which is good, because let's face it, we're just a bunch of nerds playing games). So, without further ado, let me tell you what I thought about Hauntii.

First off, the art style in this game is simply stunning. I mean, those stick figures with their soulful eyes and whatnot? It's like looking at a watercolor painting come to life! The two-tone aesthetic is also super cleverly-orchestrated, if you know what I mean. And don't even get me started on the level design - it's like a work of art!

Now, about the gameplay... Well, let me tell you, it's not all sunshine and rainbows (although, that would be nice). The puzzles can be a bit frustrating at times, especially when the map doesn't offer much help. And don't even get me started on the slower Twinstick-Shooter action moments - they're like trying to solve a Rubik's cube while being attacked by bees!

But hey, despite its flaws, Hauntii still manages to have some real charm and character (see what I did there?). The possession-based mechanic is actually pretty neat, even if it does feel a bit gimmicky at times. And those set-pieces? More like set- pieces-ing! You know what I mean - they're just so darn cool!

So, in conclusion, Hauntii may not be perfect, but it's definitely worth checking out. Just don't expect too much from me, the reviewer, because let's face it, I'm a bit of a joke (or at least that's what my therapist says).
